internal.content: --- title: "Temporal Grouping Training" date: 2022-11-03T10:57:46+01:00 weight: 65 --- ## üöÄ TASK: Define and run Temporal Grouping training üåè Documentation for the Task: Setting up training for temporal grouping This AI algorithm can start to discover groups of alerts after a pattern is learned, which might take hours or days. For example, if a problem occurs in the first and the fourth week of January and again in March, the algorithm learns to group the alerts that tend to co-occur when a problem happens. In this section you will set up and run the training for this AI algorithm to `learn patterns` in alert occurence and group patterns with `temporal correlation`. ## Define Temporal Grouping Training 1. In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Operate`/`AI Model Management` 1. Under `Temporal Grouping`, click on `Set up training` 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Done` ## Run Temporal Grouping Training 1. Click on the `Temporal Grouping` card 1. Click on `Train Models` 1. Status should say `In progress` 1. And eventually say `Deployed`

For example, if a problem occurs in the first and the fourth week of January and again in March, the algorithm learns to group the alerts that tend to co-occur when a problem happens. In this section you will set up and run the training for this AI algorithm to `learn patterns` in alert occurence and group patterns with `temporal correlation`. ## Define Temporal Grouping Training 1. In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Operate`/`AI Model Management` 1. Under `Temporal Grouping`, click on `Set up training` 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Done` ## Run Temporal Grouping Training 1. Click on the `Temporal Grouping` card 1. Click on `Train Models` 1. Status should say `In progress` 1. And eventually say `Deployed`
